IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE HARLEM EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES FUND (HEAF) CHANGES THE LIVES OF YOUNG PEOPLE BEGINNING IN MIDDLE SCHOOL AND CONTINUING IN COLLEGE AND BEYOND THROUGH A YOUTH DEVELOPMENT APPROACH THAT INCLUDES RIGOROUS YEAR-ROUND ACADEMIC ENRICHMENT, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL EXPOSURE AND CONSTANT INDIVIDUAL ATTENTION. HEAF IS COMMITTED TO CREATING EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES AND EQUAL CHANCES FOR OUR SCHOLARS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO CHANGE THE LIVES OF YOUNG PEOPLE, BEGINNING IN MIDDLE SCHOOL AND CONTINUING IN COLLEGE AND BEYOND, THROUGH A YOUTH DEVELOPMENT APPROACH THAT INCLUDES RIGOROUS YEAR-ROUND ACADEMIC ENRICHMENT, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL EXPOSURE AND CONSTANT INDIVIDUAL ATTENTION. HEAF CREATES PATHWAYS TO COLLEGE AND THE WORKFORCE FOR MINORITY YOUTH BY PROVIDING RESOURCES THAT HELP THEM ACHIEVE HIGHER EDUCATION, FULFILLING CAREERS, AND GREATER LIFETIME EARNINGS. HEAF IS COMMITTED TO CREATING EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES AND EQUAL CHANCES FOR OUR SCHOLARS.
IRS990.Desc: HEAF'S MIDDLE SCHOOL PROGRAMMING, HIGH EXPECTATIONS, PROVIDES EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING, INSTRUCTION IN MATH AND ELA, AND PREPARES STUDENTS FOR THE COMPETITIVE NYC HIGH SCHOOL ADMISSIONS PROCESS. PROGRAMMING RUNS AFTER SCHOOL 4 DAYS EACH WEEK AND FOR SEVERAL WEEKS DURING THE SUMMER.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HEAF'S HIGH SCHOOL PROGRAMMING, COLLEGE QUEST OFFERS A WEALTH OF ENGAGING EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES TO OUR STUDENTS. IN ADDITION TO ACADEMIC ENRICHMENT, STUDENTS TAKE PART IN CULTURAL EXPERIENCES, A STEAM CLASS, OPPORTUNITIES FOR EXPOSURE TO CAREER PATHS AND TRAVEL THROUGH LEARNING FOR SOCIAL AND GLOBAL IMPACT. HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS ALSO PREPARED FOR THE SAT AND COLLEGE APPLICATIONS. HEAF ALSO SUPPORTS STUDENTS AS THEY TRANSITION TO COLLEGE. PROGRAMMING RUNS AFTER SCHOOL 4 DAYS EACH WEEK AND FOR SEVERAL WEEKS DURING THE SUMMER.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: HEAF'S YOUTH DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM TRANSCENDS THE IDEA OF A TRADITIONAL ACADEMIC CLASSROOM AND IS INSTEAD A SPACE THAT RECOGNIZES THE STUDENT AS THE EXPERT OF THEIR OWN EXPERIENCE AND PROMOTES THE SHARING OF ONE'S THOUGHTS, FEELINGS, AND IDEAS. THE PROGRAM OFFERS OPPORTUNITIES FOR LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, CHARACTER BUILDING, CAREER EXPLORATION, AND SERVICE-LEARNING ACTIVITIES. ALL STUDENTS IN OUR MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL PROGRAMMING ALSO ATTENDED YOUTH DEVELOPMENT CLASSES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: ORGANIZATIONAL ACTIVITIES-PROFESSIONAL STAFF MUST MODEL A HIGH STANDARD OF EXCELLENCE, RESPONSIBILITY IN THEIR INTERACTIONS WITH STUDENTS, FAMILIES, AND COLLEAGUES. COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS WITH FAMILIES ARE INTEGRAL TO STUDENT SUCCESS. IN ADDITION TO PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF OUR STAFF, ORGANIZATIONAL ACTIVITIES, INCLUDE GENERAL ACTIVITIES SUPPORTING COMMUNICATIONS, ALUMNI AND VOLUNTEER INITIATIVES.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: HEAF MAINTAINS ASSETS THAT ARE LIMITED IN THEIR USE BY DONOR-IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS AND RESTRICTED FOR INVESTMENT IN PERPETUITY. THE INCOME AND GAINS FROM INVESTMENT OF THESE FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE TO SUPPORT THE OPERATIONS AND VARIOUS PROGRAMS OF HEAF, INCLUDING THE COLLEGE QUEST PROGRAM (WITHIN THE ACADEMY HIGH SCHOOL PROGRAM).

HEAF RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT HEAF HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE. HEAF IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS PRIOR TO FISCAL 2020.
PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISER EXPENSES, FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 11E 76,000. DIRECT EXPENSES OF OTHER SPECIAL EVENTS 2,782.
PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISER EXPENSES, FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 11E 76,000. DIRECT EXPENSES OF OTHER SPECIAL EVENTS 2,782.

FundraiserActivityInfoGrp.ActivityTxt: FUNDRAISING AND PRODUCTION OF ANNUAL GALA

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AGREEMENT WITH POWERED BY PROFESSIONALS, INC. PROVIDES FOR PAYMENT OF FEES FOR SERVICES ON A MONTHLY BASIS, AS WELL AN INCREMENTAL FEE BASED ON GROSS EVENT REVENUE. EXPENSES EXCEEDING $500 REQUIRE HEAF'S WRITTEN APPROVAL.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: STIPEND FOR COMPLETION OF YDL PROGRAM

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS: HEAF IS COMMITTED TO OFFERING NOMINAL SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND STIPENDS TO STUDENTS WHO HAVE PROVEN THEMSELVES TO BE DEDICATED SCHOLARS AND COMMUNITY CITIZENS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TO BE USED TO FURTHER THE EDUCATION AND CULTURAL EXPOSURE OF THE STUDENT. THE ORGANIZATION AWARDED SENIOR SCHOLARSHIPS TO EXCEPTIONAL GRADUATING 12TH GRADERS. COLLEGE ATTENDANCE IS THE PRIMARY REQUIREMENT AND IS VERIFIED THROUGH SCHOOL ROSTERS AND STAFF VISITS. GRADUATING SENIORS APPLY AND THE WINNERS ARE SELECTED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED. THE ORGANIZATION'S ONWARD PROGRAM CONTINUES TO MONITOR STUDENT ENROLLMENT IN COLLEGE FOR 4-6 YEARS. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO AWARDED TEN $500 STIPENDS TO INDUSTRY IMMERSION SUMMER PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS, AND THREE $300 STIPENDS TO LEADERSHIP WORKSHIP PARTICIPENTS. THE ALEXANDRA KORRY SCHOLARSHIP, ESTABLISHED IN 2020, HONORS THE EXTRAORDINARY LEGACY OF ALEXANDRA DAVERN KORRY, A TRAILBLAZING LAWYER, EDUCATOR, AND CIVIL RIGHTS CHAMPION, WHO CHAIRED HEAF'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS DURING SOME OF ITS FORMATIVE YEARS. THE SCHOLARSHIP IS AWARDED ANNUALLY TO ONE OR MORE COLLEGE STUDENTS INTERESTED IN PURSUING LAW, SOCIAL JUSTICE, OR SOCIAL WORK IN GRADUATE SCHOOL. THE TOTAL AWARD IS $10,000 FOR USE TOWARD COLLEGE EXPENSES AS THEY ARE INCURRED, AND THE RECIPIENT ALSO RECEIVES MENTORSHIP BY THE KORRY SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE.
THE ORGANIZATION'S FORMER PRESIDENT & CEO RECEIVED A SEVERANCE PAYMENT IN 2022 AS REPORTED IN PART II, COLUMN B(III).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM AND REVIEWED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S CHIEF FINANCIAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER. IT IS THEN SHARED WITH THE PRESIDENT & CEO, AND BOARD CHAIR AND TREASURER FOR THEIR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PRIOR TO FILING, THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES, GIVING THEM AN OPPORTUNITY TO REVIEW, ASK QUESTIONS, AND PROVIDE FINAL APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES THAT ALL TRUSTEES, OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES AANNUALLY DISCLOSE IN WRITING TO THE ENTIRE BOARD IF THEY OR ANY MEMBER OF THEIR IMMEDIATE FAMILIES OR ANY ORGANIZATION WITH WHICH THEY ARE AFFILIATED, PRESENTLY TRANSACT BUSINESS WITH HEAF. IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO DETERMINE IF A DISCLOSURE IS A CONFLICT AND REVIEW CONFLICTS ONCE DETERMINED. THE INTERESTED PERSON WITH A CONFLICT IS NOT ELIGIBLE TO VOTE ON MATTERS DIRECTLY PERTAINING TO THE MATTER. MINUTES OF CORRESPONDING MEETINGS REFLECT DISCLOSURES MADE AND THAT THE INTERESTED PERSON ABSTAINED FROM VOTING, AND WAS NOT COUNTED FOR THE PURPOSE OF DETERMINING A QUORUM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE 15A: THE ORGANIZATION USED AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT AND A COMPENSATION SURVEY/STUDY TO ESTABLISH THE COMPENSATION OF THE NEW PRESIDENT AND CEO. THE COMPENSATION WAS APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND DOCUMENTED IN THE MEETING MINUTES. THE PROCESS LAST OCCURRED IN JULY 2022 LINE 15B: THE COMPENSATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S CHIEF FINANCIAL & ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER WAS DETERMINED USING COMPARABILITY DATA OF SIMILAR POSITIONS AT SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS. THE COMPENSATION WAS APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND DOCUMENTED IN THE MEETING MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: HEAF MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION AS REQUIRED UNDER SECTION 6104 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE BY MAKING IT AVAILABLE ON ITS WEBSITE. THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS A BUDGET AND FINANCE COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
